issues.description: The example/test code in the template's Main.java uses two-argument constructors for Seal, Pig, and Goat (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")), while the intended design (UML and solution) defines these animal classes with a single-argument constructor that only initializes the name. This mismatch can confuse students about how many constructor parameters they should implement and may cause compilation or test discrepancies if students follow the template Main example.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template example with the intended design. Either (A) update template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to use the single-argument constructors (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle"), Pig("Doodle"), Goat("Buttinsky")), or (B) if two constructor parameters are intended, update the problem statement/UML and the solution classes to include and document the additional attribute(s) and provide corresponding constructors. Option A is recommended to preserve the current UML and solution design (animals only have a name).
